fullText: “Water” has more exuberance than wit; more catchphrases than character.
bwwExcerpt: “Water” has more exuberance than wit; more catchphrases than character. While the second half lumbers along like a pre-flight Dumbo, the wrong scenes and songs are given too much breathing room and important events such as, you know, murders and catastrophic stampedes are raced through to curtain call. Although “Water” is a love story, that becomes one of its less appealing aspects.
dtliExcerpt: “Water” has more exuberance than wit; more catchphrases than character.

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic uses a balanced comparison structure that suggests the show has energy but lacks substance in writing and character development, indicating fundamental flaws that outweigh any positive elements. | GPT-4o-mini: The review indicates significant shortcomings in character development and wit, leading to a clear negative recommendation.
